intro: Epilobium × treuinfelsianum, commonly known as the hybrid willowherb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers in racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wet meadows, riverbanks, and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
